section.title: Project Proposal Requirements
section.para: A project may be started based on a first draft of a proposal, even if it leaves some or all of these questions unanswered. In this case the project is only granted CVS-privileges later on, after a complete proposal is submitted and approved by the MMC. The idea here is to allow for a preliminary inception phase to investigate the feasability of the project and determine the scope.
A project proposal should provide sufficient information to answer these questions:

1) Motivation
Why is this project necessary?
Why does this have to be an MMBase project instead of an external package?

2) Goal
What is the purpose of this project?
Which goals need to be achieved in order to consider the project completed?

3) Design
What are the key classes in the design?
What are the key technologies used?
Which existing parts of MMBase are extended/leveraged?

4) Impact
Which existing parts of MMBase are modified?
Which new packages will be created?
Are there backward compatibility issues?

5) Planning
What is the estimated planning and total duration of the project?
